We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Location: Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

	The successful candidate will be responsible for providing exceptional customer service, handling visitor registrations, and ensuring a smooth and efficient experience for clients, visitors, and employees.

	Provide exceptional customer service, ensuring that all guests feel welcome and valued.
	Manage the front desk, handling guest registrations, check-ins, and check-outs.
	Handle room assignments, key card management, and guest requests.
	Maintain accurate records of guest interactions, including complaints and compliments.

	Manage and maintain records, files, and databases, ensuring accuracy and confidentiality.

	Provide information and assistance to clients, visitors, and employees, responding to their queries and resolving issues.
	Develop and maintain knowledge of hotel services, amenities, and local attractions.

	Maintain a high level of customer service, ensuring that all interactions are professional, friendly, and courteous.
	Perform other administrative tasks as required, such as ordering supplies, managing the office calendar, and coordinating meetings and events.

	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and problem-solving skills.

title: Job Openings at St. Dominic Catholic Hospital
content:
St. Dominic Catholic Hospital is a 64 bed hospital located in Ogungbade, off New Ife road Ibadan. St Dominic Catholic Hospital is the vision of the Dominican Sisters of St Catherine of Siena (Italy). We offer various medical services such as: General medicine, internal medicine, O & G, Laboratory, and Radiology, to mention just a few. The hospital is run in collaboration with foreign partners. We are registered and licensed by the Corporate Affairs Commission and the Ministry of Health. Also, we are accredited by the NHIS as both primary and secondary healthcare providers.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Registered Nurse / Midwife
     

            
    



Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Assess, plan, implement, and evaluate care for women during pregnancy, labor, delivery, and postpartum.
	Conduct prenatal and postnatal examinations.
	Provide education and support to women and their families on pregnancy, childbirth, and parenting.
	Take/Assist with deliveries and perform midwifery procedures as needed.
	Collaborate with obstetricians and other healthcare professionals to develop and implement care plans.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of patient care.
	Participate in quality improvement initiatives to improve patient outcomes and satisfaction.
	Stay current with evidence-based practice and professional development.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Midwifery or a related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of work experience as a Registered Nurse Midwife.
	Current registration as a Registered Nurse / Midwife with the relevant professional body.
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
	Commitment to patient-centered care and evidence-based practice.
	Resident in Ibadan (Iwo Road, New Ife Road axis).


Salary
N80,000 - N170,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 30th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Application Letter to: adm.sdchib2019@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
Note: Ibadan resident only.

 

 

2.) HMO Officer

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Medical Health Insurance Officer is responsible for managing and coordinating health insurance-related activities within the hospital. This role involves verifying patient insurance coverage, obtaining authorizations, and ensuring compliance with insurance policies and regulations.


Key Responsibilities


	Insurance Verification: Verify patient insurance coverage and benefits.
	Authorization Management: Obtain and manage insurance authorizations for treatments and procedures.
	Claims Management: Assist with claims submission, follow-up, and resolution.
	Patient Education: Educate patients on insurance coverage, benefits, and financial responsibilities.
	Policy Compliance: Ensure compliance with insurance policies, regulations, and hospital procedures.
	Communication: Collaborate with insurance companies, patients, and hospital staff to resolve issues and improve processes.


Requirements


	Education: Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., healthcare administration, business).
	Experience: Previous experience in health insurance, patient access, or a related field.
	Skills: Strong analytical, communication, and problem-solving skills.
	Knowledge: Familiarity with health insurance policies, procedures, and regulations.


Working Conditions:


	Work Environment: Hospital setting.
	Shift Work: Typically regular business hours, with possible flexibility for peak periods.


Salary
N50,000 - N80,000 per month. 

Application Closing Date: 31st August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application Letters and CV to: adm.sdchib2019@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Hospital Accoutant

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Hospital Accountant is responsible for managing financial transactions, preparing financial reports, and ensuring compliance with financial regulations.
	They play a key role in maintaining the financial health of the hospital.


Key Responsibilities


	Prepare and review financial statements, reports, and budgets.
	Manage accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger.
	Conduct financial analysis and provide recommendations.
	Ensure compliance with financial regulations and hospital policies.
	Collaborate with hospital departments to improve financial performance.
	Develop and implement financial policies and procedures.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or related field.
	Accounting Certification
	2 - 5 years of relevant experience in healthcare accounting.
	Strong knowledge of accounting principles and financial regulations.
	Proficiency in financial software and systems.
	Analytical and problem-solving skills.


Skills:


	Financial reporting and analysis.
	Budgeting and forecasting.
	Accounts management.
	Compliance and risk management.
	Communication and collaboration.


Salary
N120,000 - N180,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 31st August, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application Letters and CV to: adm.sdchib2019@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Vacancies at Tailored Talent
content:
Tailored Talent is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the following positions below:

1.) Business Development / Sales Executive

Job Location:  Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	A growing Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) firm is hiring a goal-driven Business Development / Sales Executive to lead international client acquisition.
	The ideal candidate should have experience working with U.S. or European clients and a solid understanding of the BPO/outsourcing space.
	This role involves managing the full sales cycle from generating and qualifying leads to closing deals and reporting performance.


Key Responsibilities


	Generate and close B2B leads in the U.S. and Europe
	Conduct outbound sales via email, LinkedIn, and calls
	Manage and update sales pipeline records
	Present value propositions to decision-makers
	Track performance metrics and prepare sales reports
	Collaborate with internal teams for seamless client onboarding
	Stay informed on trends in outsourcing and remote talent


Requirements


	At least a bachelor’s degree in business, Marketing, or a related field
	3–5 years of experience in B2B sales or business development
	Proven experience working with U.S./European clients or firms
	Strong understanding of BPO, outsourcing, or remote talent services
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and closing skills
	CRM proficiency (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce, Pipedrive)
	Able to work independently, meet sales targets, and report accurately


Bonus Qualifications:


	Experience in outsourcing or talent solution sales
	Background in tech, HR, or staffing
	Familiarity with international business etiquette.


Salary
N750,000 per month. 

Application Closing Date: 31st August, 2025. 

Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Personal Assistant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	Our client is seeking an organised, proactive, and resourceful Male Personal Assistant to provide high-level administrative and operational support to C-suite Executive.
	The ideal candidate will play a critical role in ensuring the smooth functioning of the office by managing schedules, handling correspondence, and supporting the execution of strategic initiatives.


Key Responsibilities
Administrative Support:


	Manage the executive’s calendar, schedule meetings, and coordinate appointments.
	Handle confidential correspondence, emails, and phone calls with professionalism.
	Prepare reports, presentations, and documents as required.


Office Management:


	Organise and maintain office files and records, ensuring easy access and retrieval.
	Oversee office supplies and ensure the office runs efficiently.
	Act as a liaison between the office and other departments or external stakeholders.


Personal Task and Project Coordination:


	Assist with Executive's personal tasks, errands, etc.
	Assist in planning and executing projects and initiatives.
	Follow up on deliverables and ensure timely completion of assigned tasks.
	Coordinate travel arrangements, including flights, accommodations, and itineraries.


Stakeholder Engagement:


	Build and maintain positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
	Professionally represent the office during interactions and meetings.


Research and Reporting:


	Conduct research on various topics as needed and provide insights.
	Prepare briefing notes and summaries to keep the executive informed.


Qualifications


	Education: Degree in a relevant field.
	Experience: Minimum of 2 years of experience in an executive or personal assistant role. Previous experience in a high-paced or corporate environment is a plus.


Skills:


	Exceptional organisational and multitasking abilities.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other productivity tools.
	Strong problem-solving and decision-making capabilities.


Personal Attributes:


	Results-oriented with a proactive and entrepreneurial mindset
	Discreet and able to handle confidential information with integrity
	Proactive and able to anticipate needs before they arise.
	Strong interpersonal skills and a professional demeanour.


Salary
N150,000 - N200,0000 per month. 

Application Closing Date: 31st August, 2025. 

Click here to apply online

 

3.) Middle NodeJS Backend Engineer

Job Location: Nigeria
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Middle NodeJS Engineer to lead all technical aspects of the platform.
	The ideal candidate will have deep experience with NodeJS, AWS, Pulumi, Prisma ORM, Git, and GitLab.
	This role will drive the company’s technology strategy, ensure the robustness and scalability of the platform, and foster a culture of excellence and innovation within the engineering team.


Key Responsibilities


	Backend Development: Actively participate in coding and code reviews, particularly in NodeJS and Prisma ORM.
	Cloud Management: Oversee the architecture and deployment of our platform on AWS, ensuring high availability, scalability, and security.
	Version Control: Manage version control systems, specifically Git and GitLab, to ensure efficient and reliable development workflows.
	Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including product management, design, and marketing, to deliver high-quality products and features.
	Innovation: Stay up to date with the latest industry trends and technologies, and drive continuous improvement and innovation within the team.
	Project Management: Oversee project timelines, ensuring timely delivery of milestones and managing resources effectively.
	Quality Assurance: Implement best practices for software development, testing, and deployment to maintain high standards of quality and reliability.
	Security: Ensure that all technology practices adhere to regulatory standards and compliance requirements.
	Budget Management: Manage the technology budget, ensuring cost-effective use of resources.


Preferred Qualifications


	Education: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
	Experience: Minimum of 2 years of experience with NodeJS, cloud platforms and technologies.
	Familiarity with DevOps practices and CI/CD pipelines.
	Knowledge of data privacy regulations and best practices.
	Experience in a startup or high-growth company environment.


Required Qualifications:


	Experience: Proven experience writing NodeJS backends in a fast-paced, agile environment.
	Technical Skills: Extensive hands-on experience with AWS, NodeJS, Prisma ORM, Git, and GitLab.
	Problem Solving: Excellent problem-solving abilities and a proactive approach to addressing technical challenges.
	Communication: Strong communication skills with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.


Application Closing Date: 24th September, 2025.
